This document is the description of the classes and interfaces used in rapla.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
org.rapla
This package contains the classes for initializing a rapla-system.
org.rapla.components.calendar
Contains widgets for date- and time- selection.
org.rapla.components.iolayer
The IO layer is an abstraction from the io differences in webstart or desktop mode.
org.rapla.components.layout
This package contains additional LayoutManagers.
org.rapla.components.tablesorter  
org.rapla.components.util
Some more helpful tools.
org.rapla.components.util.iterator
Iterators used by Rapla.
org.rapla.components.xmlbundle
Components for storing locale-specific resources in xml-files.
org.rapla.entities
Contains the interfaces of the persistent entity-objects in rapla.
org.rapla.entities.configuration  
org.rapla.entities.domain
The main domain entities of rapla (reservations and resources) are located in this package.
org.rapla.entities.dynamictype  
org.rapla.examples  
org.rapla.facade
This package contains the facade, that encapsulate the storage and the entitie package and provides a simple interface for accessing the rapla-system; Study this package to get a good summary of the functionality of Rapla.
org.rapla.framework
This package contains the framework, that is responsible for component creation with dependency injection.
org.rapla.gui
This is the base package of the GUI-client.
org.rapla.gui.images  
org.rapla.gui.toolkit  
org.rapla.plugin
This is the base package of the GUI-client.
org.rapla.plugin.mail  
org.rapla.plugin.tableview  
org.rapla.servletpages
Contains the default pages served by the rapla server servlet

This document is the description of the classes and interfaces used in rapla.

 Version 1.6.0

For more information contact the developers mailinglist or take look at the documentation section on our homepage.

See Also:
http://code.google.com/p/rapla, mailinglist
